project.name: fosdem2007-belgium
project.longname: Free and Open Source Software Developers' European Meeting
project.description: This subproject is a place to hold informations on organizing the Gentoo booth at the Fosdem 2007 (Free and Open Source Software Developers' European Meeting).

body.p: Our room will be AW1.124. The capacity is 59 seats. Hours we have it Saturday: 14:00 -> 19:00 Hours we have it Sunday: 09:00 -> 18:00

Note that on Saturday, it is not possible to use the room before 14:00 as university courses are being held in all rooms until then. We should start our schedule at 14:15 as we most probably won't be able to enter before 14:00. For that reason, The event will end at 19:00 on Saturday (instead of 18:00).
body.pre: (Organisators ask us the following:) Please take care of having everyone out of the room for that time, as we staff members have a lot of work to do on Saturday evening, so throwing everyone out will be your job ;)

pre.caption: list we have to provide fosdem07 Ppl

body.pre:
- - the name of your project (Gentoo Linux) - - a short and longer description of your project (Gentoo Linux) - - website URL and optionally related URLs (www.gentoo.org, http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/index.xml?showlevel=1) - - the full schedule of the talks and activities that will take place in your DevRoom with, for each talk: - start time, end time (obviously ;)) - the name(s) of the speaker(s) - a few words about the speaker(s), can even be a full bio (*) - optionally, a photo of the speaker - optionally, one or more URLs about the topic
(*) I know it's a lot of work, but just delegate it to the speakers ;)

(This schedule is not confirmed) 14:00 -> 14:30 :: Welcome Dimitry Bradt (diox) 14.30 -> 16.00 :: Gentoo Hardened - the hardened toolchain and the security perspective of the Gentoo Linux distribution Alexander Gabert (pappy-) 16.00 -> 17.00 :: Introduction to ebuilds Bryan Østergaard (kloeri) 17.00 -> 18.00 :: Security Raphaël Marichez (Falco) (Confirmation?) 18.00 -> 18.45 :: General Discussion to gentoo's future All Developers

(This schedule is not confirmed) 09:00 -> 10.00 :: (To fill in) 10.00 -> 11.00 :: (To fill in) 11.00 -> 12.00 :: Gentoo's inner working: The Council Mike Frysinger (vapier) 12.00 -> 13.00 :: Release Engineering: Tinderbox testing Chris Gianelloni (wolf31o2) 13.00 -> 14.00 :: Noon Break ** (Closed door debate) 14.00 -> 15.00 :: What makes Gentoo a community based distribution? Christel Dahlskjaer (christel) 15.00 -> 16.00 :: The portage Marius Mauch (genone) 16.00 -> 17.00 :: (To fill in) 17.00 -> 18:00 :: (To fill in)

body.p: This is the list of people related to this event:

tr.ti: Gentoo developer - Apache, Bugday, Developer Relations, Gentoo/Alpha, Gentoo/IA64, Gentoo/X86 and Python
Gentoo developer - Games, QA, Base System, *
Gentoo developer - UserRel, DevRel, Alpha, Mips, PR, Events, RelEng, Recruitment, QA, Adopt-a-Dev, Bugday, Conflict Resolution
Gentoo developer - German translations, Gentoo/PPC, Gentoo/HPPA

body.p: This is the list of stuff we need

tr.ti: Number of Gentoo developers to book for.
Booking Hotel Rooms one month in advance / 42 euro&s a night/ 3 or 4 ppl a room
Someone with a valid driver license
Order a van, to move devs from Hotel -> Fosdem -> Restaurant -> Hotel
Book a good/cheap restaurant. Ping sejo about it!
